llm_outputs.raw_model_response:
Based on the information provided in the input, here is the relevant extracted information for the Scenic Corridor Overlay (SCO) district:

{
    "extracted_text": [["The width of the scenic overlay within the rural scenic corridor shall be 10% of the lot depth but no more than 100 feet from the edge of the public right-of-way.", 113]],
    "rationale": "This text specifies the minimum lot size for the Scenic Corridor Overlay district, which is defined as a percentage of lot depth with a maximum value.",
    "answer": "10% of lot depth (max 100 ft)"

The input provides information about the Scenic Corridor Overlay (SCO) district, including its intent and requirements. While there is no explicit "min_lot_size" stated, the closest equivalent is the width requirement for the scenic overlay, which is defined as 10% of the lot depth but no more than 100 feet from the edge of the public right-of-way for rural scenic corridors. This effectively sets a minimum size for the overlay portion of lots in this district.
extracted_text: The width of the scenic overlay within the rural scenic corridor shall be 10% of the lot depth but no more than 100 feet from the edge of the public right-of-way.
llm_outputs.rationale: This text specifies the minimum lot size for the Scenic Corridor Overlay district, which is defined as a percentage of lot depth with a maximum value.
